channel.title: Port forwarding
channel.description: hey is there a way of portforwarding my server without a user/ pass my dad set a pw... also i heard of reseting the the internet connection, somone said it "could shut down the internet for a few days" i was wondering if that will happen, i am using comcast.

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @rageboy rageboy
item.description:
@rageboy wrote:

right now my server is down, if i port forward it should i be able to log on?

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Fringe_Division1 Fringe Division
item.description:
@Fringe_Division1 wrote:

utorrent sucks, your server will have random dcs since utorrent isn’t very stable. click the reset button on your router and it should let you reset the password for your router and from there you can portfoward.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

Download? ;o,

If you’re gonna reset your Router, then you can host it from your computer directly, just portfoward the correct network ip and open the ports you’re using (5555, 43594, or 43595).

If you wanna use uTorrent too try and host, then no need too reset your router at all.

Just search uTorrent in google, and download. And under the settings there should be something too open a specific port.
If you use uTorrent, you have too turn on your server before uTorrent, otherwise the server will respond with a message (Port already in use!).

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

rageboy:

will i go offline at all, i have to do school online i dont want to get behind:(, back to this utorrent stuff does it have a virus, and does it have a limit of player like habachi?

uTorrent begins to become laggy around 30 players… If you reset you’re router, you won’t loose internet, probally for about 10 seconds.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Dark_Soul3 Dark___Soul
item.description:
@Dark_Soul3 wrote:

rage I don’t think it will take you offline for a few days, Ive actually had to do the same thing you had to do a couple times. Just take a pin or something and push the reset button for about 15 seconds and I’m about 95% sure you won’t lose your internet.
